column2: One Michelin star restaurant. Tuesday to Saturday dinner only. Plates are picturesquely beautiful and the food, flawless.
Two Michelin star restaurant. Tuesday dinner, Wednesday to Saturday lunch and dinner. New Danish cuisine. Rene Redzepi kickin' butt.
Matt Orlando, former chef at The Fat Duck.
One Michelin star restaurant. French-inspired conservative gourmet restaurant.
Two Michelin star restaurant. Great architecture.
column5: Per Henrik Lings Allé 4, 2100 København Ø

column2: One Michelin star restaurant. Bornholm produce of super high quality. New Nordic food, less avantgarde than some. Should be high on yo' wishlist.
One Michelin star restaurant. Outstanding haut Thai cuisine. The only Michelin Thai restaurant in the world.
Not avantgarde, but classic and sharp. Elegant too.
One Michelin star restaurant. Nordic produce with an Italian twist and French cheeses.
One Michelin star restaurant. Noma like restaurant with its own twist.
One Michelin star restaurant. Danish and French mixes.
Relaxed Kiin Kiin. Asian crossover food. Tuna tartar, fish cakes, pomelo salad, grilled prawns, red curry, earl grey ice cream, passion fruit kumquatz and orange cake
WEIRD. Strawberries and shrimp. Vanilla ice cream with black olives and licorice.
Italian, and great Brunello di Montalcino wine collection.
Relaxed Kadeau Københaven. Go for the Pony Spark.
Modern eatery. Juicy sous-vide peasant with burnt leeks. Wine pairings are excellent.
Excellent béarnaise sauce. Bistro classics, lobster, foie gras, turbot, longoustine, veal, snails, steak frites, crème brulee.
Relaxed Formel B. Liberal French-conservative restaurant.
Tuna tartar. Pork bun gau bao.
Wine bar and bistro. Classic French. Go charcuterie or tartar.
Modern gastronomic eatery. Wine bar. Danish avantgarde tapas.
Grilled pork and beef sausages on slow-fermented sourdough bread and linseed. Don't be a health nut and ask for potato and parsnip mash instead of bread (sounds equally as good).
Tapas-style menu. Salted cod. Beetroot tartar. Scallops with crispay celeray.
Snegl (snail), spiral cinnamon butter icing sugar cake.
4-day old sourdough bread. Airy on the inside, crispay on the outside. Mueslibread. Check out Lagkagehuset too.
Can't get Noma. Come here. Upcoming. Classic Danish. Leverpostej (liver pate), pickled herring.
Just in case you miss shoddy America.
Cream puffs the size of your head.
Known for its pastries and breads.
Okay burgers. Steak burger = bad idea.
The Jane's sister bar. Better than the Jane?
Chinese themed bar, with legit drinks.
Favorite place so far in Copenhagen
Street art n' shit. Rock climbing. Dew it.
